text:
AbstractReport.getResponseElement() calls WebdavUtils.getAbsolutePath
with a serverUrl argument instead of a servletPath.
As a result the ReportMethod returns hrefs like this:
<D:href>
/webdavhttp%3A//mycomputer.fiz-chemie.de%3A8080/history/1234/1.0
</D:href>

This is contextPath + quoted server url + resourcePath.
Fix: Replace the serverURL argument in AbstractReport and all children
with the servletPath and make sure, ReportMethod passes the servletPath.

Open question: Is a absolute URL including server name /port number 
required in href element? I don't think so, since for slide the history
will always exist on the same server as the resource. Adding the server
name would make usage of proxies problematic.
